intro: Pultenaea graveolens, commonly known as the Sweet Broom, is a shrub native to Australia. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, characterized by its compound leaves and pod fruits. The plant features small, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. Its leaves are typically trifoliate, with three oval-shaped leaflets. Pultenaea graveolens is often found in sandy or rocky soils, thriving in full sun conditions.
